intro: Tapeinosperma poueboense, commonly known as the Congo star apple, is a small evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
